info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 3:28PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL TAOS AND WEST CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 328 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Taos Ski Valley, or 16 miles northeast of Taos, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Angel Fire, Eagle Nest, Taos Ski Valley, Cimarron Canyon State Park, Eagle Nest Lake State Park, Elizabethtown and Vietnam Veterans Memorial State Park. This includes Highway 64 near Mile Marker 272, near Mile Marker 274, and between Mile Markers 276 and 294. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.
